definitions.definition: Used to mark the beginning of the last in a list of items or propositions.
examples: Firstly, that's illegal; secondly, it has serious disadvantages; thirdly, it's not necessary; and lastly , did I mention that it's illegal?

definitions.definition: Used to signal that the speaker is about to yield control of the conversation .

main_definition: ( sequence ) Used to mark the beginning of the last in a list of items or propositions.
secondary_definitions: ( discourse marker ) Used to signal that the speaker is about to yield control of the conversation .
